You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
The roots of $z^6+z^4+z^2+1=0$ are the vertices of a convex polygon in the complex plane.  Find the sum of the squares of the side lengths of the polygon.
inference:
Let the roots be $z_1, z_2, \ldots, z_6$.  Then the side lengths are $|z_1-z_2|, |z_2-z_3|, \ldots, |z_6-z_1|$.  The sum of the squares of the side lengths is

$$\begin{split} &|z_1-z_2|^2+|z_2-z_3|^2+\cdots+|z_6-z_1|^2 \\\ &=(z_1-z_2)(\overline{z_1}-\overline{z_2})+(z_2-z_3)(\overline{z_2}-\overline{z_3})+\cdots+(z_6-z_1)(\overline{z_6}-\overline{z_1}) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}-z_1\overline{z_2}-z_2\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2})+(z_2\overline{z_2}-z_2\overline{z_3}-z_3\overline{z_2}+z_3\overline{z_3})+\cdots+(z_6\overline{z_6}-z_6\overline{z_1}-z_1\overline{z_6}+z_1\overline{z_1}) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1\overline{z_2}+z_2\overline{z_3}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_1}) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z

question:
Let the roots be $z_1, z_2, \ldots, z_6$.  Then the side lengths are $|z_1-z_2|, |z_2-z_3|, \ldots, |z_6-z_1|$.  The sum of the squares of the side lengths is

$$\begin{split} &|z_1-z_2|^2+|z_2-z_3|^2+\cdots+|z_6-z_1|^2 \\\ &=(z_1-z_2)(\overline{z_1}-\overline{z_2})+(z_2-z_3)(\overline{z_2}-\overline{z_3})+\cdots+(z_6-z_1)(\overline{z_6}-\overline{z_1}) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}-z_1\overline{z_2}-z_2\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2})+(z_2\overline{z_2}-z_2\overline{z_3}-z_3\overline{z_2}+z_3\overline{z_3})+\cdots+(z_6\overline{z_6}-z_6\overline{z_1}-z_1\overline{z_6}+z_1\overline{z_1}) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1\overline{z_2}+z_2\overline{z_3}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_1}) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z_1) \\\ &=(z_1\overline{z_1}+z_2\overline{z_2}+\cdots+z_6\overline{z_6})-2(z_1z_2+z_2z_3+\cdots+z_6z
